property.name: EditorId
property.summary: Gets or sets the Editor ID associated with this form.

property.name: FormId
property.summary: Gets the Form ID associated with this form.

property.name: IsConstant
property.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether this Global Variable is a constant.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Gets or sets the type of this Global Variable.

property.name: Value
property.summary: Gets or sets the value of this Global Variable.

method.name: HasTag
method.summary: Determines whether this form has been tagged with the specified text.

method.name: Tag
method.summary: Tags this form with the specified text.

remarks.p: Valid types of a Global Variable are Types.Short, Types.Int and Types.Float. When creating a new Global Variable form property Type should be set before property Value is be set.

Value should be set to a value of the correct type as specified by property Type. The engine will try to convert the value if necessary to avoid run-time errors but large numbers may get truncated or precision may get lost if the type cannot sustain the value.
Changing the value of a constant Global Variable value results in a warning.
